sample_name.description: The user-defined name for the sample.
sample_name.label: Collecting Sample id

covv_virus_name.description: The user-defined GISAID virus name assigned to the sequence.
covv_virus_name.label: GISAID Virus Name

covv_orig_lab.description: The name of the agency that collected the original sample.
covv_orig_lab.label: Originating Laboratory

examples: 655 Lab St, Vancouver, British Columbia, V5N 2A2, Canada
covv_orig_lab_addr.description: The mailing address of the agency submitting the sample.
covv_orig_lab_addr.label: Originating Laboratory Address

examples: 123 Sunnybrooke St, Toronto, Ontario, M4P 1L6, Canada
covv_subm_lab_addr.description: The mailing address of the agency submitting the sequence.
covv_subm_lab_addr.label: Submitting Institution Address

covv_collection_date.description: The date on which the sample was collected.
covv_collection_date.label: Sample Collection Date

covv_location.description: The country of origin of the sample.
covv_location.label: Geo Loc Autonomic Country

examples: e.g. Human, Environment, Canine, Manis javanica, Rhinolophus affinis, etc
covv_host.description: The taxonomic, or scientific name of the host.
covv_host.label: Host Scientific Name

covv_patient_age.description: Age of host at the time of sampling.
covv_patient_age.label: Host Age

covv_specimen.description: A substance obtained from an anatomical part of an organism e.g. tissue, blood.
covv_specimen.label: Organism Substance

covv_assembly_method.description: The name of software used to generate the consensus sequence.
covv_assembly_method.label: Consensus sequence software name

covv_gender.description: The gender of the host at the time of sample collection.

examples: e.g. Illumina Miseq, Sanger, Nanopore MinION, Ion Torrent, etc.
covv_seq_technology.description: The model of the sequencing instrument used.
covv_seq_technology.label: Sequencing Instrument Model

covv_coverage.description: The average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.
covv_coverage.label: Depth of coverage value

covv_fasta_filename.description: Filename that contains the sequence without path

examples: e.g. Patient infected while traveling in â€¦.
covv_add_host_info.description: If the information is unknown or can not be shared, leave blank.
covv_add_host_info.label: Additional Host Information

covv_last_vaccinated.description: The date the host received their last dose of vaccine.

examples: Date, Location e.g. type of gathering, Family cluster, etc.
covv_outbreak.description: If the information is unknown or can not be shared, leave blank.
covv_outbreak.label: Outbreak Exposure Event Location

examples: e.g. Sentinel surveillance (ILI), Sentinel surveillance (ARI), Sentinel surveillance (SARI), Non-sentinel-surveillance (hospital), Non-sentinel-surveillance (GP network), Longitudinal sampling on same patient(s), S gene dropout
covv_sampling_strategy.description: The reason that the sample was sequenced.
covv_sampling_strategy.label: Purpose of Sequencing

submitting_lab_sequence_id.description: Sample ID given by the submitting laboratory

examples: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
covv_subm_lab.description: The name of the agency that generated the sequence.
covv_subm_lab.label: Submitting Institution

covv_subm_sample_id.description: Sample ID given by the submitting laboratory
covv_subm_sample_id.label: Sample ID given by submitting laboratory

covv_provider_sample_id.description: The user-defined name for the sample.
covv_provider_sample_id.label: Sample ID given by originating laboratory
